noun.description: English or Dutch tin-glazed earthenware, typically decorated by hand in blue on a white background.

proper noun.description: A town in the Netherlands, in the province of South Holland; population 96,168 (2008). The home of painters Pieter de Hooch and Jan Vermeer, it also is noted for its pottery.

origin: Originally Delf, from Dutch delf ditch, still the name of the town's main canal.
